item.title: Bloomberg dibuka 06/25/2024 - feeds.bloomberg.com

item.title: Glen point's neil phillips menghindari penjara untuk manipulasi fx - feeds.bloomberg.com

item.title: Login 06/25/2024 - feeds.bloomberg.com
item.description: Jonathan Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz and Annmarie Hordern have the economy and global markets "under surveillance". Their daily conversations with leaders and decision makers from Wall Street to Washington and beyond cover the latest in business, investment, and geopolitics. No other program better positions investors and executives for the trading day. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Cass dan lew columbia di alokasi aset dan risiko portofolio - feeds.bloomberg.com

(Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: India bergerak steadily toward 8% pertumbuhan tahunan, gubernur rbi says - feeds.bloomberg.com

Of all the actor career renaissances we’ve seen over the last couple decades, Hugh Grant’s might be the most fun. He pivoted from the go-to charming and/or smarmy romantic comedy lead to playing weirdos, goofballs, and creeps. Imagine a row of dominoes that starts with Paddington 2 and trips all the way down to Heretic…

item.description:
The details continue to show a hesitant but not overly concerned consumer.

In June, the Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index fell modestly to 100.4 from a downwardly revised 101.3 the previous month. That's despite lower petrol prices in early June and the S&P 500 reaching a record high in the days leading up to this month's survey deadline. The report was about as mixed as it could be.

Income expectations fell, vacation plans increased, and households' perceptions of the labour market and business conditions remained largely unchanged. All of this resulted in a fairly stable confidence reading, as evidenced by the chart, which showed it remaining within its recent narrow range.

Average 12-month inflation expectations ticked up from 5.3% to 5.4%.

item.title: Airbus shares drop 10% as plane maker cuts guidance and forecasts fewer deliveries - feeds.content.dowjones.io
item.description: Airbus said supply-chain issues will see it deliver fewer planes this year and lead to a slower-than-expected increase in production of its A320 aircraft.

item.title: Investors only have eyes for tech stocks right now. here’s what they’re missing. - feeds.content.dowjones.io
item.description: Fundstrat’s Mark Newton sees a short-lived tech and market selloff running its course and urges a focus on some other sectors largely ignored up to now

item.title: Larry summers blasts ‘free lunch’ ideology of left-wing democrats - feeds.content.dowjones.io
item.description: Former U.S. Treasury Secretary Larry Summers took aim Monday at some in the progressive movement who he said are not taking seriously the costs associated with government programs aimed at creating jobs and boosting economic growth.

item.title: Carnival cruise line’s stock rises after company swings to a profit - feeds.content.dowjones.io
item.description: Carnival also signaled smooth seas ahead for its financial performance, with advance bookings for 2025 now running ahead of 2024 in both prices and occupancy.

item.title: Amazon unveils prime day dates — but target and walmart events come first - feeds.content.dowjones.io
item.description: Walmart Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. have announced their competing summer shopping events, offering discounts on a wide range of goods to inflation-weary consumers.

item.title: Oil prices ease back after brent’s highest finish in nearly 2 months - feeds.content.dowjones.io
item.description: Oil futures declined on Tuesday, with prices easing back after front-month Brent ended the previous session at a nearly two-month high, buoyed in part by geopolitical worries.

item.title: Consumer confidence dips again. americans anxious about the economy. - feeds.content.dowjones.io
item.description: Consumer confidence fell slightly in June and reflected the ongoing uncertainty among Americans about the future of the economy

item.title: As micron earnings near, this bull stands by his case for a $225 stock price - feeds.content.dowjones.io
item.description: Micron stands to benefit from pricing trends in the memory market — even if it weren’t to do any high-bandwidth-memory shipments next year.

item.title: The us is being flooded by chinese vapes - www.wired.com
item.description: The US government vowed to crack down on the sale of illegal nicotine vapes. They only got cheaper, fancier, and more potent.

item.title: Microsoft faces eu charges over ‘abusive’ bundling - www.wired.com
item.description: The European Union has issued competition charges against Microsoft, accusing it of illegally linking Teams with Office.
